text: False means untrue. If something is false, it means it is not real. A falsehood is anything said that is not true. A falsehood can also be a series of lies, told to "prove" something that is false itself. In logic, "false" is one of the truth values (with the other one being 'true'). This is written as \bot, F or 0. == Related pages == * Contradiction == References == Category:Logic Category:Basic English 850 words
title: False
